sentences.en: A smirk flickered at the corner of his mouth as he watched my struggle.
sentences.cn: 他看我挣扎的样子,嘴角闪过一丝幸灾乐祸的笑容.

sentences.en: Come on, professor, does not smirk at me like that.
sentences.cn: 拜托!老师, 你不要那样对着我假笑.

sentences.en: Compare smirk, sneer, frown, scowl and grimace.
sentences.cn: 试比较smirk 、 sneer 、 frown 、 scowl、grimace这几个词.

sentences.en: Does George Bush possess a disarming grin, or a facetious smirk?
sentences.cn: GeorgeBush的笑,是可亲的露齿而笑, 还是滑稽的傻笑 呢 ?

sentences.en: He had a self-satisfied smirk on his face.
sentences.cn: 他脸上挂着得意扬扬的笑容。

sentences.en: He made no attempt to conceal his smirk.
sentences.cn: 他毫不掩饰自鸣得意的笑容.

sentences.en: He said, with something of a smirk.
Her mouth was drawn back into a smirk of triumph.
sentences.cn: 她咧开嘴，洋洋得意地笑了起来。

sentences.en: I'll smack that smirk off your face, punk!
sentences.cn: 我要打扁你那一脸的奸笑该死的家伙!

sentences.en: Ikkaku only reply with a smirk and posing ready to fight.
sentences.cn: 一角对此只是抱以冷笑展开战斗姿势.

sentences.en: It was hard not to smirk.
She had a selfsatisfied smirk on her face.
sentences.cn: 她脸上带着自鸣得意的微笑.

sentences.en: The boys tried not to smirk.
sentences.cn: 男孩们强忍住得意的笑。

sentences.en: To smirk or laugh in contempt or derision.
sentences.cn: 嘲笑轻蔑或嘲弄地假笑或笑.

sentences.en: Wipe that smirk off your face!

trans.tran_en: to smile in an unpleasant way that shows that you are pleased by someone else’s bad luck or think you are better than other people
